snippet: The Astros’ Chris Johnson hit two home runs and starter Chris Schwinden allowed five runs in four innings as the Mets ended a six-game trip with a 2-4 record.
abstract: Houston Astros defeat New York Mets, 8-1, in MLB action. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON -- Mike Pelfrey had the ability to drive Mets fans mad with his inconsistency. Some of them may be missing him now. Pelfrey's rotation spot came up Wednesday for the second time since he was placed on the disabled list with a season-ending elbow injury, and for the second time Chris Schwinden, his immediate successor, failed to keep the Mets in the game.

headline.main: Pelfrey's Fill-In Falters For 2nd Straight Time
